newsitem.title: IRAN: Tremor jolts northwest Iran, no casualties.
newsitem.headline: Tremor jolts northwest Iran, no casualties.

text.p: An earthquake on Tuesday jolted an area in northwestern Iran where a quake killed nearly 1,000 people a few weeks ago, the Iranian news agency IRNA said.
It quoted Morteza Baqerzadeh, governor of the quake-stricken Nir area in Ardabil province, as saying the tremor damaged some houses but left no casualties.
The quake, measuring 4.1 on the Richter scale, hit at 10:44 a.m. (0614 GMT), the agency said.

In late February, an earthuake measuring 5.5 on the Richter scale killed nearly 1,000 people and injured more than 2,500 in Ardabil. It left 36,000 people homeless in the snow-swept mountainous region.
A force four earthquake is powerful enough to cause heavy damage in a populated area.
